oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civilian Conservation Corps Boxing Ring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two members of CCC Camp 496 battle each other in a boxing ring on camp grounds, as camp spectators gather around the ring to watch.

CCC Camp 496 was located in Lexington, Tennessee. An alternate location is .5 miles south of Henderson. The camp was designated TVA-29; this indicates it was a Tennessee Valley Authority camp. Another number associated with the camp is #2448.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); Civilian Conservation Corps -- Photographs; Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.) -- History; New Deal, 1933-1939; Boxing
